channel.title: whonix slowly work
channel.description:
Hello. allocated 8GB of RAM whonix workstation(IN Virtual Box) 6 CPU.(IN Virtual Box)
slowly work. use on VirtualBox when you enter text quickly in the console, the letters appear late. on the desktop, if you move the mouse quickly, there is a small delay.
I tried it on different devices. what could be the reason, how to increase productivity?
there are no such problems when installing other debian-based systems in virtualbox. only with whonix used SSD PAE/NX Enabled Nested Paging enabled.

item.title: whonix slowly work
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
mriops:

but there are micro lags mouse/text write

Mouse I don’t know.

Text keyboard key press might be delayed because of Kloak in context of:

Whonix – 2 Dec 21

Keystroke Deanonymization

deanonymization using user keystrokes, keystroke deanonymization, keystroke fingerprinting

mriops:

How to properly add power to the system

Kicksecure – 27 Jan 22

Kicksecure ™ Tuning

Making Kicksecure ™ Faster. Tuning Kicksecure ™.

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)

mriops:

How to do it?

Same as with Debian.

Whonix – 26 Jan 22

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

ZeroFlag:

I can’t tell for VirtualBox but for Whonix in KVM the default setting use CPU pinning which limits Whonix to one physical CPU core no matter how much cores you assign in the config. I don’t know if that’s the case for VirtualBox as well but it would explain why it feels slow for Whonix but not for other Debian (based) distros.

Not the case for VirtualBox. At time of writing not using CPU pinning.

Read full topic

item.title: whonix slowly work
item.dc:creator: ZeroFlag
item.description:
I can’t tell for VirtualBox but for Whonix in KVM the default setting use CPU pinning which limits Whonix to one physical CPU core no matter how much cores you assign in the config. I don’t know if that’s the case for VirtualBox as well but it would explain why it feels slow for Whonix but not for other Debian (based) distros.

item.title: whonix slowly work

item.description:
There are no major delays, but there are micro lags mouse/text write
Read troubleshooting, not help me
How to properly add power to the system, a swap file can increase? How to do it?
